bBxC0Z3f14KE-D3WZIjHLw.text: Excellent service. Our waitress was very helpful with the menu selections. The food was very good. We chose the small plates to share and all of our selections were very good.

8vKlspsghDZpqQL9VkAFdA.text: Just had a lovely dinner at The Stanley, one of our favorites. The small plates are creative and delicious. However, after dinner, our group of 4 decided to hit the bar and have another drink before heading home. There were 3 chairs together so one of us was going to have to stand until the party next to us left, which they said they were about to do. The bartender made it very clear that we all had to sit or one would have to wait outside. WHAT!?! So my husband saw an empty chair a few seats down and went to move it to our group. OH, NO YOU DON'T! The bartender made it clear that was not allowed! Bottom line we were treated like some kind of "riff-raff" that he would rather not be there at all. Basically, the bartender had a really crappy attitude and his demeanor was that of a real turd. We will not be going back.

eq8j46SjNLTz1dygYfOLuQ.text: Walked in and sat at the bar with my daughter. We shared a burger and chicken biscuit. Delicious!!

oGFty-PclwKSvo8Ckki3Lw.text: Typically dont post reviews but it was a really disappointing experience tonight.  I dont know if this is the right space for the restaurant, the dining area is disjointed and its hard to have a quiet conversation in the back room because the acoustics are terrible/loud. The menu looked great but the execution wasnt good, the pork chop was overcooked and very dry. The drinks were unimpressive especially for being priced higher than comparable restaurants. Kindred or Heirloom it certainly is not...

hfwn5pQQmNdyw2AzTwwHzw.text: Great service, exciting food and cocktails! Chris P., our server, was wonderful! He explained some of the more complex dishes, gave awesome recommendations and truly made our dining experience special! Recommendations include: Steam buns, the trout with beet risotto and the mezcal/sauvignon blanc cocktail! Fun night out!

CvdYtJRuBUIKXcZX-J4OjA.text: We were excited to try this place.   It was not up to par.  Food was sub par and we were not impressed at all.  There are many other upscale restaurants in Charlotte that have b Tyler survive and food.  Went for a Birthday and left and walked to Fig Tree instead for apps and drinks.

hRxaAP_fjbPRGJnXAvtw8A.text: The food here is SO GOOD. Fresh, local, vibrant and interesting, I would love to go back and try a different dish on their ever-changing menu. The appetizers did feel a bit over-priced, they are definitely too small to be enough for more than one person and should probably be about half the price for the amount of food served. The cocktails were also fabulous. Guests were fairly dressed up. The atmosphere is splendid.

EhHDGctk1R7IIXHkKD1Bjg.text: Beautiful renovation of former space, welcoming atmosphere, friendly and knowledgeable server (Neal), extensive wine list with some great deals, well crafted and balanced bourbon cocktail, shared several small plates- very fresh, seasonal ingredients. Some small plates were larger than others- ask server for details so you know what to expect. Highlights- Italics red blend, surf and turf, charcuterie and cheese for dessert.

X1c4MDHZ6uhFl0gMpzLVxQ.text: We were patrons of Heritage and were excited for Chef Paul's new restaurant The Stanley. As usual, we were in for a treat. The sweetbread, aka calf thymus gland, was a real surprise. It was cooked to perfection with a smooth texture and savory sauce. The cocktails were delicious. My husband had the pork chop and I had the steak; both were excellent. The ambience is warm and inviting. Dessert was the strawberry shortcake with strawberry sorbet served with fresh marinated strawberries. The Stanley is a restaurant where the menu changes often and you just have to be comfortable with the unexpected. Chef Paul is innovative and scary talented and he continues to push the boundaries of a myriad of established cuisines. It's sort of Southern cuisine with a French twist but really, the food here defies categorization and that's a good enough reason to keep coming back.

BjmceUfQyHpC8IbF0mcMVg.text: Absolutely outstanding. Me and my lady like to share plates and eat slowly while enjoying libations and each other's company. Larry's cocktails were absolutely amazing, and each course was perfect to leave us full and satisfied but never over or underwhelmed. The scallops were the standout, green beans were great to start, and the pork belly was absolutely divine. Service was perfect. What a nice addition to the Elizabeth/plaza area. Its like Soul gastrolounge without having to feel like you're in Zoolander.

dNgNCeBDmdotfuTpL4o2vA.text: I have visited this restaurant twice and the menu was slightly different each time.  The menu items are inventive.  I'd specifically recommend the steam buns and surf and turf, which are worth the hype.  However, some items seemed overpriced.  I ordered the $17 scallops small plate (among other small plates) to split with a friend; we were surprised when a single scallop was served in a cast iron dish in a chilled watermelon sauce with a few tiny pieces of fruit.  The scallop was cooked well, but not worth $17.  We also ordered a $13 squash blossom, which was similarly very small and not worth the money.  I would suggest asking about the portion size (especially when ordering any small plates) before placing an order.

yTdxcurSMzWKHJHaYS-zwQ.text: We had an amazing dinner at The Stanley. Food was phenomenal. It was hard to not just order all the starters on the menu. We took our waiters tip and ordered 3 and one entree for my wife and I to share!    Risotto was amazing as were all the starters we tried!

pQVYnjfVcYOzvgKlObwjTA.text: Good food, great service and to clarify I'm straight and was with my husband. However, I heard if you want to sit next to you husband (and you're a guy), it's "not the restaurant for you". This just happened to my cousin, so not making this up! So bummed to hear this! You make the decision if you want to support this place. It's amazing how there are reviews about this topic that are "not recommended". What? Interesting!

uPUQuE3rTLqHpkMz1FqTHw.text: My husband and I were impressed with the service and ambience!  Our waitress was lovely from beginning to end and we enjoyed a nice, leisurely paced meal (exactly what we'd hoped for).  The small plates - a meat selection that included an amazing chicken liver foie gras, a creamy fettuccine with ham and a perfect scallop and a tempura quail were awesome!  We split the fried chicken and tried the carrot cake for dessert- which, while both were good, they didn't totally knock it out of the park for us.  Overall great experience and we will be back again as the menu changes regularly and we are excited to try more!

zqf0qEAHJCu0jZAMn0dvUw.text: Did not care for the 2 Chardonays they had and the price per glass was ridiculous!  We are all foodies and travel every week for work! Nothing infuriates us more having to pay $14.00 for a glass of wine , knowing the bottle is the same exact price! We asked if we could substitute one of the vegtables and the answer was " NO"!Totally rubbed ys the wrong way!  If you are going to charge $ 28.00 to $55.00per entree and a customer wants to sub a vegtable for another vegtable, I think the customer should be accommodated! Have lived in this neighborhood for 20 years! Excited about the restaurant but please be more accommodating and and have more reasonable prices for the entrees and wine by the glass! Thank you!

Vnen9qFVjD4QvpIUIWJxHg.text: Best all-in restaurant experience I've had in a while.  High quality cocktails, eclectic small plates and excellent main dishes and desserts. Fun spot, highly recommend.

Ice0uBUSLGHIFiuXixZXyQ.text: After hearing mixed reviews about our neighborhood's new concept, I decided to give them a little while to figure things out. Unfortunately still looks like they have a ways to go.  The food looked beautiful on the plate but most of the time lacked the flavor and consistency you expect from a restaurant of this price point. We enjoyed a couple dishes flavor but those came to us cold. The cocktails didn't excite and the couple we did order were overly sweet and lacked creativity. A lot of the wine list can be found at our neighborhood supermarket for about the price of the glass which is safe but unimaginative. The service was at times cold and not as refined as the similar restaurants in town... and I did not notice a manger on the floor during our visit on a busy weekend night.  Overall, our high expectations of Paul Verica's new concept left us wanting more for our money.  I hope there are improvements on our next visit as we will be trying again.

21YUoBIkVs7TAZv5eFvtTQ.text: Being from the neighborhood we decided to get a sitter and try out the new place. We arrived at 508. There were two tables out of 20 that had people at it. After the hostesses discussed whether we should get a table or not, they opted for us to sit at the bar. The restaurant was EMPTY both front and back. No where on any of your sites does it say reservations only. Nevertheless we left and went to another local place that does not judge. #carpediem

9mDP5qdbuFuapFl1aDzd4g.text: I absolutely love this place. Food is amazing, staff is great, topped off with a great cocktail and wine lists. If you haven't been you are missing out!

Pl_5XPHCCWOX4Ai34JzCJA.text: A great restaurant for foodies! We were not disappointed! We were treating someone from out of town who wanted an authentic Charlotte restaurant. The Stanley exceeded our expectations. Our guest had the "Thanksgiving Quail" and was over the moon. The pork belly pasta was amazing as well as the tuna dish. Simple flavors and deliciously executed. Even though these were small plates, we each had one and didn't share and it was ample! We will definitely return!!!

MCxtRMb9Nsgym61OTipwkQ.text: A world-class addition to the Charlotte restaurant scene. This is a beautifully designed blend of new and old but completely inviting.  The food is as beautiful. I say that because you need to stop for a second and realize how much thought went into each plate.  I had an Asparagus appetizer that was called "Asparagus as many ways as we could think of".  We lost count at 5 different ways, and it was spectacular. Service was proper but welcoming.  Nothing stuffy about it.   I really am not sure what else I can say about it. Loved it! Can't wait to see how they change their menu as the seasons change.

N_ImlACvThsg3R6q_hXW2g.text: The Stanley has been on my radar since I finally heard that they were opening up. The wife and I had a few hiccups with trying to get in for our reservation as they had some last minute construction that needed finishing up this past weekend. Either way, I was able to secure a last minute-ish time for Saturday night after our Friday one needed to be cancelled. The restaurant is laid out a little strange as there is a front dining room and bar area, and a separate back dining area, with the kitchen kind of being in between the 2. Now I know that some guests have commented on the acoustics in the back dining area and it certainly was loud when we were first seated, but it was definitely due to a 6 top of people who were super above normal decibel levels. There was a definite hush in the room when they left even if the rest of the dining area was still packed. Either way, on future visits, I would opt for the front dining area or the bar itself. I'm not completely sure, but I don't think that the same acoustic issues would be the case there.   The service was attentive and allowed us to take time to make decisions on drink and food all the while explaining us the concept and the menu. The wife decided in a salad to start and the trout with beet risotto for her main. I went full on freestyle and got 3, well 4 in total small plates if you include the pate, which I made my dessert. The wife went more traditional for dessert with the strawberry shortcake. I started with the mushroom soup, which was the only off the menu special I believe. There were a few delivery issues as the thicker soup was difficult to pour out of it's carrying vessel. The server apologized and said that the chef was still working out a few kinks with the presentation. The flavor was there and I really enjoyed it, so no problem in any event. Next up I had the sweetbreads which were served with the inspired flavors of buffalo chicken wings. Blue cheese dressing/sauce, carrot foam and hot sauce. The sweetbreads were pan fried I think with some light batter on them. I was glad that they weren't deep fried as I don't feel like that is the best presentation for them. I really liked the idea, and the flavors were all represented well. Hopefully, there will be a continued presence of the sweetbreads on the menu maybe with other presentations, like an entree version. Next up was the beef tartar, which was a little disappointing, as I have had better versions. Sightly under seasoned on the tartar and really the dish didn't have any wow factor after the sweetbreads. As previously mentioned, I chose the pate for my dessert as I clearly didn't have enough meat at this point in the evening. The country pate was good, but the pork belly rillette ball was over the top good and really closed out the meal for me on a high note. It was deep fried and appears in the middle of the picture. I highly recommend this dish to anyone that loves meat. The wife said that her goat cheese and strawberry salad, and her trout were delicious, as I can attest since I snuck a few bites. The drink menu is varied for cocktails and the wine list was pretty extensive, so there should be plenty of options for all. Some drinks were hit and miss for me, but I really enjoyed the After Dinner which had bourbon, fernet, coffee and a dairy ice cube. As the ice melts, the drink changes and it was delicious. Looking forward to future visits at The Stanley and explore more of the menu as it changes with the seasons.

L4E8lIxWV19j2L-41wfRtw.text: We went to The Stanley for the first time last night and absolutely loved it! The menu was creative and diverse, the environment very friendly, and the staff warm and engaging. Even the General Manager, Stephen, gave us personal attention.  Meal prices were reasonable, and the wine list diverse and good.  This is an excellent restaurant.  We will most certainly be back and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a new, creative option in the Charlotte area.

auEni37VFnn8RSdwNXV0gA.text: This place is hands down one of the best restaurants we have been to in Charlotte. Truly farm to table! Justin was awesome, guiding us through the menu and describing items perfectly. Each plate is crafted with thoughtfulness and precision, it's more than just good food. We cannot wait to go back again!!

5-oxEnB_NfybALHbE4wmfw.text: The Stanley was a great Sunday brunch experience!  Starting with the mimosas and tempura shrimp. The mimosas had fresh squeezed orange juice which the bar tender Damien, organically hand squeezed himself! The broccoli tasted great and was a good portion! The main course the short rib sandwich was very tasty however the presentations was a bit underwhelming. We expected a larger portion after ordering off of the main entree menu. The sandwich could have been made better by having a larger serving size of meat. For desert we got the vanilla doughnut which was beautiful and rich in flavor! Damien was a great bartender/server, as he was personable and gave us privacy to chat with each other. The restaurant itself was super cute and inviting!

c8LMSbhrllYsRXQ37LAk_A.text: We have been to some of the best restaurants in the country. The Stanley is a very good farm to table restaurant with the prices of an expensive french restaurant. Reduce your prices 20% and the price/value will keep you in business. The menu demands some explanation, which our server did not offer or provide.

LqnJjAWHGkd46_VaxJDqqg.text: I took my husband here for his birthday. We love tapas and this place did not disappoint! The food was phenomenal and service was excellent. They brought us complementary Prosecco to celebrate his birthday. I would recommend and we will be back! Thank you, the Stanley for making my husband's birthday and memorable one!

_7iSfAMPJrV4sEGSluTkfQ.text: Awful experience. I will never understand the culture where high-end restaurants hire rude and cold waitresses. If you're overpaying for food, shouldn't service be EXTRA stellar? On top of that, the food was just terrible - two of the four of us took one bite of our meal and our server didn't even ask what was wrong. Also, one of the members of our party ordered a coke, which comes in a small 8oz cocktail glass (fountain soda with ice) and they charged for every refill without even mentioning it. So the one coke he ordered cost him $12. Most importantly, The food quality was surprisingly low. The chicken salad sandwich tasted like a salt-lick, actually inedible. I have absolutely no idea how this place is going to make it. They need a major attitude adjustment, above all else. There are too many good places in Charlotte for this one to last.

ShP5tBojrCzXrC5ujGhzhg.text: The overall experience was pretty terrible. I should have known when the Starbucks next door had better EQ, as evidenced by the fact it had two functional umbrellas as opposed to zero. The staff was snooty and patronizing. While I understand that reservations take priority to walk ins, there were no tables available whatsoever, even though two parties of 3 and 4 walked out while no one entered the entire time we were there. The table was unstable and rickety. While the food was edible, I almost thought they had confused my entree with an appetizer the portions were so small.  There are so many other better brunch places in Charlotte. Save your money and an opportunity to be disrespected. If I would have known I wouldn't have even bothered. Should have left after the donut when my spider sense started tingling that this was going to be a miserable ride. It was.

ITuJFDZHkWqWKXY7Iryf2A.text: We knew the chef from his time at Heritage and the amazing food there followed its way to Elizabeth ! Phenomenal service, great food! Cocktails menu is a game changer and all the the small plates are amazing (Bens plate of meat is awesome!) We also had the shrimp with beet risotto and it is a great sharing option. Atmosphere is great too - intimate, warm and still comfortable, like your favorite local place dressed itself up!

kGEdLJszkHG9SUDWmB68BQ.text: Excellent.  New special restaurant although just getting a couple of small plates isn't that pricey.  Everything is fresh and seasonal and staff is courteous prompt knowledgeable.

2IN2_vXLfZZRJ9Wc_IFOtw.text: My husband and I had dinner here last Saturday because a friend of mine LOVED the chef's previous restaurant. It was amazing!  We had an 8:30pm reservation and were seated immediately. The staff was attentive and fun. We ordered 5 small plates and it was plenty of food. My favorite was the fried chicken steam bun with watermelon salsa. Every item individually was perfect and together it was even better. We ended the meal with one of the most delicious desserts I've ever had in my life (at our server's recommendation)...tempura bread pudding with homemade caramel ice cream. The only thing I regret is not taking any pictures to share!

6XS8-2JP0TH1QMo8m0IwHA.text: We tried this restaurant because of the many reviews. We found the interior decor to be nice though the back room was very noisy. The service was standard. Quick but not overly attentive.  The food was presented well with imaginative visual presentations. We had tomato mozzarella, buttermilk chicken and one other dish. Unfortunately we quickly agreed that the flavor did not match the visuals. The dishes tasted uniformly bland. The review would have been three stars but for the price of soda. We were charged by the glass (quarter can quantity). So two thirds of can of soda cost $9. No pricing for this anywhere on the menu. Confirmed with waiter when bill arrived. Seems a rip of by any measure.

IomILAINDhaM20XT3FP-2w.text: Wow what an incredible experience. I dined here a few weekends ago. My husband and I ordered the steam buns which were a southern delight. We ordered the trout which was very filling. We ended the dinner with the bread pudding which is possible the best I've ever had. The manager gave us great wine advice and was very knowledgeable. Overall the service was great. The Stanleyville was my favorite cocktail that I tried. All of the dishes here are unique and creative. If you're looking for a new dining experience like nothing else in Charlotte, make a reservation here on the Resy app. They seated us promptly and the front dining room is beautiful. We will be back to see what Chef Verica has come up with next time!

fVCKTA1VK5_Muvn6DgjS2g.text: Absolutely love The Stanley. The interior is gorgeous. Chef Paul Verica is creating magic with his menu. The menu changes frequently because he sources everything locally. It's a must visit

KQsIeITHHQqlHXt0benzbg.text: Our favorite restaurant in Charlotte hands down. We've been multiple times and each visit the menu has been different, but every single plate we have ordered has been fresh and fantastic (if they are available, don't miss the surf and turf and the bread pudding).  Our go to spot for special occasions like birthdays and anniversaries or for a weeknight meal at the bar and everything in between.   With regards to some of the more recent comments here regarding the staff and ambience, go visit for yourself and then reach your own conclusions.  Paul, Steve, Neil and Mary Jean are some of the finest people we've ever come across in the hospitality business and their work and commitment to creating a fantastic experience for every single patron that visits The Stanley speaks for itself.    Would give it 6 stars if I could...

_AIqMtIj2et51l4AKIE2uQ.text: I should say my husband and I had a restaurant in the QC for nearly 13 and we have eaten in Michelin Star restaurants all over the world.  So when we are impressed it means something.  We had a wonderful meal.  We so enjoyed Chef Ben's Charcuterie plate very much chicken liver pate with a clarifies buttered top (get outta town good) with real mortadella and pork rillettes (my my my thats dynamite) and it was then on to the tourchon foie gras!  Yummmmm, so delicious with peanut butter and muscadine jelly on brioche was the height of sophistication with southern elements; Well done Chef Paul! The steam buns were banging!  Let's just take the most insanely crispy and juicy fried chicken with ginger and sesame balanced with peppery spicy radishes...good God! Yes, I can build a life with these little babies.  I had the arugula salad that was stage best I've ever had.  I mean could you beat country ham, apples, pecans, blue cheese with wait for it a maple vinaigrette!  I could have had just that and would have been overly content but no...dish after dish it was a feast to savor.  Our 4 year old had the Buttermilk fried chicken entree and when I tell you he licked the plate I'm not lying.  We ordered a side of mashed potatoes of which he proceeded to use his drummet as an implement to scoop them into his little mouth. My cocktail was the 7th & Pecan.  I ordered it because it had all of my favorite elements (barrel rested Cardinal Gin, Italian Zacca and Cardomaro) truly as perfect as it gets for a brown liquor drinker who loves gin.  The crescendo was dessert, which was a crispy log of bread pudding and house made salted caramel ice cream. I mean need I say more.  I do not have a sweet tooth but it had just a hint of salt that made the caramel sweetness all the more enjoyable, it was sooo good!  The service was tops!  Never was there an empty glass or dirty dish left in front of us which is what you always hope for and rarely experience in Charlotte.  It was exceptional as was my overall experience at The Stanley!  Go.  Now!

7F6hLeK_Tg2l5CrYSWhreQ.text: I was very excited to try The Stanley after rave reviews from the Charlotte Agenda. The restaurant is beautiful. Unfortunately the ambience could not make up for lackluster service and bland food. We found the drinks to be tasty though a bit overpriced. The steam bun stood out among the appetizers. The asparagus many ways was beautiful on the plate but lacked flavor. Of the entrees, the pork chop was well received by the group. The risotto featured over cooked shrimp and was a small portion size for the price. The trout lacked flavor. I hope they are able to work out some of these kinks with more time.

cAxmh9PKf3EDqD5_kvzSTQ.text: Fire alarm went off over 4 times during dinner. Underdone noodles in the short rib dish. Ultra Violet drink was a super sour, seriously sour. Pork buns were fantastic. Wanted to have dessert but those darn fire alarms kept going off.

xm5UG_HiAUQN4248m80_Og.text: Stopped in to have a drink at the bar and was told that you must be seated to be served. Ugh! What kind of crap is that? I can't just stand by the bar and have a drink? This was the second time I came in to give The Stanley a chance. We ate some apps at the bar and although the food was good, the bartender seemed very cold. As if she was doing us a favor by taking care of us.  Such a shame, it really is a cute neighborhood restaurant.

1OYwU5FSPmTEQrDO_wbb5g.text: We were very excited to try The Stanley as we appreciate the creativity and community support of farm to table. Chef Paul Verica did not disappoint, as the food was inventive and refreshing. The farm fresh vegetables were truly the star of all the dishes we tried and we advise that you eat EVERYTHING on the plate!   We would highly recommend every small plate that we tried, as each one was more delicious with every bite: the Hot Pocket, scallops, tempura broccoli, and strawberry balsamic salad with goat cheese. For entrees, we were pleased with the presentations and portion sizes. Again, the vegetables truly starred in each dish. We tried the strip steak, trout, pork chop, and shrimp risotto. Each protein was well cooked - our only critique is that each entree dish was a bit under seasoned and could have used some salt.  The cocktail list is inventive and original. While price for the size was a little mismatched, we were pleased with the flavor development and creativity of the Mezcal is the New Black (smoky, but sweet) and the Nobleman (tart and refreshing).  Justin provided excellent service and enthusiastically guided us through the menu and helped maximize our experience as a party of 5.  Overall, the experience was delicious and fun, the service was refined yet laid back, and the decor is beautiful. Our only critique is to add a bit more seasoning to the food, which we still loved based on variety and uniqueness. We will be back.

GuTxDFoLCLNsupqruAa2Og.text: I stopped in for a glass of wine Saturday night after another function. Every time I have visited the bar at The Stanley, I've always have had a first class experience. The bartenders are kind and attentive. The cocktail and wine selections are good. As far as the food goes, what I saw other guests having looked great. If I had not already had dinner, I certainly would have ordered something. The Stanley is definitely a place to try.

XsM7NK_nVf2lISi3gP2Egg.text: I was really not sure what to expect from my first visit to The Stanley. I had heard a lot of positive buzz from foodie friends and was luckily able to get a Tuesday Evening reservation to celebrate my anniversary. Then I started reading some negative reviews and wondered what experience I would have.  It was a FANTASTIC experience!! And we will be going back for other special occasions. It was one of the top 5 meals I've had in Charlotte. The skill, the diverse menu, the flavor combinations all worked. I think we were using version 242 of the menu, which changes probably a couple times a week based on availability of ingredients.  I was told beforehand I had to have the steamed buns with whatever that version was for the particular menu. This version came with pork belly and asian flavors. We also split an order of the Gnudi with mushrooms and diced country ham. Both were excellently prepared and delicious.  For the main meal, my wife got the shrimp and beet risotto. I had the duck breast with roasted vegetables and parsnip puree. The risotto was perfectly executed. The shrimp were cooked ideally and the flavor blend was amazing. On the duck, our server told us it was sous-vide and then put on the flattop to crisp the skin. The skin also either had excellent seasoning or was sprinkled with finishing salt, but either way the duck, paired with braised greens, roasted beets and carrots seemingly all brought together The Stanley's mission on one plate. It was a perfect blend of fresh, seasonal ingredients. For dessert it was the first time I tried strawberry cobbler. It came with homemade vanilla ice cream. The cobbler was baked in a small cast iron skillet which made the crust crispy and kept the strawberries moist. What impressed my the most about this dish was that the freshness of the strawberries shone. They weren't overly sweet but they were the star of the dish.  What impressed me about the food was the attention to detail and the expertise in how the complementary parts of the dish came out. For instance, the puree under the duck brought the dish together and it was one of the best purees I've had in recent memory.  Regarding the service, we had a server named Chris and he was excellent. A lot of the negative reviews revolved around service, but we were greeted warmly by the hostess, seated promptly and Chris took care of us the rest of the night. He steered me to the duck based on the description of how it was prepared and he had a perfect balance of being there when the water was getting low and yet my wife and I had plenty of space to have a great night talking and taking in the atmosphere. He was also very professional. I was staying off my phone so I missed a text from the bank saying due to suspicious activity, our credit card had been put on hold, so when I tried to use it, Chris professionally said that their system was having problems processing the card. When I pressed him further he said it came up as declined. So I used a different card, pulled the phone out, saw the text and unfroze the other card. Turns out I had been to Teeter three days in a row and charged less than $5 each time and it was throwing up a flag. But the way the server handled the situation was ideal and the mark of a seasoned waiter.  There really was nothing to nitpick or complain about regarding the meal. If the Stanley isn't considered one of the top spots in Charlotte now, I think it certainly will be shortly.

28dA_p8lIS9qJVYsWe47Bg.text: Chef Paul and son Alex have really wowed me again! First time visiting the Stanley after enjoying Heritage many times and it did not disappoint! What amazing food and service! The wine was delicious and the cocktails are out of this world good! Stephen the General Manager was so friendly and accommodating. Fantastic experience I can't wait to come back!

1_E1xsyle0Ua0e3QiFDhbQ.text: My husband and I were in the Elizabeth neighborhood tonight and decided last minute to stop in to see if we could sneak a spot at the bar for dinner and cocktails. Upon seeing that there were six open tables as we walked up (and no other parties at the hostess stand or waiting for a table), we decided to try our luck at getting a table since a lot of people cancel their reservations during large storms. This is how our conversation went:  Me:  "Hi, we unfortunately do not have a reservation tonight, but we wanted to see if it was possible to get a table tonight without one, given the storm." Hostess: "Oh, sorry, we can't accommodate you without a reservation, but we could sit you at the lounge and have a bartender server"  Me: "oh, great thank you! Is it poss...."  While I was mid-sentence, the hostess completely turned her back to me and began to talk to some other person who had just approached the hostess table.  There was literally no one else in the near vicinity other than me, my husband and this guy that approached the table. It was horribly awkward and maybe the rudest I've ever been treated by a restaurant employee. I'm sure the food is great, but there's plenty of other great restaurants in Charlotte that treat their patrons with respect. I'll pass.

6C5YEMpbutU8CqhBzV9Z5w.text: Came in to grab a drink with my roommate. Bartender was super rude. I ordered the Elizabeth cooler which was very watered down. My friend  had the Ultra Violet and it was better. I mentioned we were interested in dessert and he dropped off the menu. 2 minutes later came over and asked if we were ready, which we were not. He then proceeded to look at his watch and say "tick tock ladies" it was 9:50, I had no clue they were closing anytime soon as their dining room was still full. I instantly felt uncomfortable and asked for the check shortly after.   Place is stuffy and not the vibe I was expecting.  Disappointing as I live in the neighborhood.

kCBvLE2ssOZLD9FOD6-7ZA.text: Since my partner and I don't eat out much and had cause to celebrate, I called ahead for a reservation and asked if the menu for the evening would have options for someone who has to follow the AIP. *This is a pretty restrictive diet but ultimately, a farm-to-table spot like this could accommodate because any meats and cooked veggies are a-okay.* The hostess quickly assured me of such when I spoke with her.   Our experience made it feel like the kitchen was phoning  it in...we ordered sunchoke chips + spicy aioli to start but instead of aioli the chips were served with some kind of southwestern buttermilk ranch. So that dish went from AIP-friendly to my partner just eating chips. Then we ordered a charcuterie plate. The main feature of this dish was the nearly 8 oz. serving of chicken liver mousse, followed by a smattering of mortadella, a deep-fried pork belly croquette, and various pickled veggies. This small plate was $18 but that seemed excessive since chicken livers, however well done, are offals. The croquette wasn't AIP-friendly. Then the veggies seemed like refrigerator pickles that had been plopped into a jar of white vinegar for a week and called a success. We decided to go elsewhere for an entree after the experience we had with the apps.   On the flip side, our server was great and the bar program was so creative; the drinks we had were delicious. The bartender sent out a beet + apple mocktail for my partner. We'll definitely return for drinks in the future and forgo the food. A James Beard nominated-chef clearly only gets this kitchen so far; too bad since they're our neighbors.

lFIEMQ5Kj3LzCeN1tM7FUw.text: Summary:  We were served room temperature champagne,  and the kitchen refused to accommodate food allergies after management said it would be no problem both in person and on the phone.  This was the worst experience at an "upscale" restaurant that I have had in Charlotte.    We were served warm champagne, poured table-side, before the waitress admitted the wine fridge was broken.   Then I was told if we have food allergies we need to call ahead.... not only did we call in advance,  I spoke with the management in person prior to making the reservation and was assured that there would be multiple items we could order and the kitchen would adjust dishes.  Instead I was told all but 3 items on the menu were off limits,  and anything with dairy in those dishes would be just left off the plate.   Why would I pay full price when you leave off 1/3 of the plating?   Ultimately ordering food was a nightmare. The kitchen refused to adjust dishes, and noted the menu changes daily so we should come back again and see if we have more options!     Given all these issues we had requested a manager stop by our table, which never happened.   This place clearly suffers from their own moderate success and ego.   Do yourself a favor and go to Fig Tree instead.

18K__Yv_YAGB9LZCvrxUMw.text: Based on reviews I had read/heard, I really expected to be impressed.  Instead I was extremely dismayed.  My wife ordered the shrimp and grits, which tasted like it had been douced in Tabasco sauce; so much so, that it smothered any other flavor.  My trout was perfectly cooked, but had no flavor except the char from the pan.  I had to use salt and pepper (which we had to grab for ourselves) for any flavor whatsoever.  I did finish it all because I was famished and we didn't have time to eat anywhere else before having to be somewhere.  The bill was out of proportion with the fare and service provided.  We were asked by the manager how everything was when the food arrived.  Had he asked after we started our meal, I would have shared our disappointment.  The atmosphere is nice, but don't waste your time.

GZ3KjAr_5YbL8SWFoCkI8A.text: Collectively, we've eaten in 5 star restaurants in the US and Europe. We came to give it a try but we left a huge fan! The ingredients played together like a symphony and presentation was a work of art! Loved it! Our server Mary Jane was wonderful!

_dArAdTOYvw78GHP6yblvA.text: What can I say? Farm to table with such creative and unique plates while still being incredibly tasty and filling. Twice nominated chef for a James Beard award. Staff is very attentive and knowledgeable. The hostess Savannah was so friendly and helpful. We didn't have a reservation, but she was able to move a couple things around and get us a great table. Will be back....

9WiRA9hiOhYQAKSHZVsh0A.text: In a nutshell this is a chef owned restaurant with good food, terrible service and too many rules. The chef needs to come out of the kitchen and see how his staff/rules are going to ruin this place. Sad cause the food was yummy.  This place started out bad right from the start. Our table faced Pecan street and every time somebody stopped by Jersey Mikes, their head lights beamed in at us. We mentioned to the server that some blinds would be a good idea and she said nothing worked in that space. It was a basics space and plenty of blinds/shades would work. We had to move our chairs and sit oddly as we were getting headaches.   The drink menu looked good, but there were no vodka drinks. We asked which cocktail would be best suited for us to substitute vodka and were told that would not be possible "the mixologist will not substitute vodka for anything." Somebody in our party wanted a bourbon on the rocks and asked for a Basil Hayden or Woodford. Our server acted like he was ordering gas station quality and finally it took us asking what Bourbon they had. A more appropriate response would have been, if you like those bourbons we have these that are similar. Quite frankly our server was just awful. We caught her rolling here eyes at us and just in a state of constant annoyance.  The food was the highlight of the evening. VERY expensive, but it was good. Skip dessert, it was just OK and not worth it. The coffee was delish though.  Finally after we were done we wanted to sit at the bar. We were told there was no standing allowed (huh??), so we found a little nook with seating that accommodated our party. We were told a server would be with us shortly. After one did not come for a while, we approached the bar only to be told we were not allowed to order from the bar and needed to order from a server. We would have been happy to if one was made available. We left and will not be back.

OaNq8WqwcXztJ8r9BIZ8wA.text: What an amazing experience!!  We arrived just in time, because it started pouring rain outside.  We were the second table in the entire restaurant, but our reso was at 5:30pm on a Wednesday.  We were quickly swarmed by guests checking in for the reservations and by 6:30pm, there wasn't a seat in the house available.  Amazing!  We started with some yummy cocktails and then transition to a bottle of mixed red wine from Chile (sooo good and full body flavors).  Our waiter was initially overly chatty and we thought we were going to get quickly annoyed by his ramblings, but as the dinner progressed he read the table very well and realized we had our own conversations to perpetuate and left us to it.  Let me tell you about the Caprese Salad Three Ways!  It is unlike anything you will ever taste.  They have somehow managed to make a "fried pork skin" texture out of a slice of tomato and oh my I know it will be a menu staple for decades to come.  The arugula salad was also very good with figs!  I almost forgot, most things are tapas style (which I generally despise because I always leave hungry no wanting to "eat the last piece of shared crumb on the plate.")  But, I had my fill here.   The chef was very accommodating and realized my vegetarian needs with a plate of mixed vegetables cooked many ways.  It was the best I've ever had!  This chef is going to be highly sought after once the word gets out, and I know The Stanley will win some awards for sure.  Seating is comfortable, air gets kinda cold, bathrooms are very clean, and parking is not the nightmare that the South End sees daily.  I cannot wait to come back and try more cocktails and enjoy more chef creations.

Bdqu4IB2FSLGIm8nYdCWcQ.text: Ricky was our server and he was outstanding. Which was wonderful since the only thing that could have marred the insanely good food would be the service. My husband is a chef, we never go out to eat. This may be one of two or three places in Charlotte where the food truly amazes. Had the shrimp and grits, the meat plate, the surf and turf and ribeye, along with the white chocolate bread pudding. Every dish was mind boggling.

z-XeCCJ_HizHb-GUpI6ouw.text: We walked in, hostess said "reservation?" (I remember when "hi" was a proper greeting, or even "welcome.") We responded "No, just popping in for a drink." And the response "You aren't allowed since we are full and everyone must be seated" was a little off-putting. Maybe "thank you for visiting us" or "could I make a reservation for you some other time?" ... I could think of a dozen other things she may have offered before ushering us out of the door.

X00-tDvXHRm1uebASnljkg.text: The Stanley was a delicious weekend brunch spot. The burger was awesome but HUGE. Could definitely have split it. Great service and atmosphere.

wQPkUDDnCpBl2epAmQoBVg.text: Not sure how this place can have a 4.0/5.0. This is one of the best restaurants in Charlotte. Fine dining at its best without feeling stuffy. Everything from the starters, to the entrees, to the dessert, to the cocktails is top notch; wonderful service as well.

t-uCP4Ebd8PQwN5L92dwHg.text: This place defines dinner as a experience, beyond taste, presentation, creative ingredients, hospitality and ambience - all of which it gets a solid 10/10.  Will come back for more...

AZZ5PMw6ual8b-8gzkMxLQ.text: The Stanley is a farm-to-table restaurant, which seems to be a popular description these days. However, unlike most farm-to-table restaurants this one stands out from the pack by having very modernist principles in its food along with a bit of rustic flair. You can tell from the plating and the choices on the menu that there was a lot of thought and love put into the food.  Boyfriend and I booked a table for 7pm on a Thursday night. Normally we try to do a weekend date, but getting a table before 9 on Saturday was a challenge. For a restaurant that has just opened within the past month, it was a good sign. The decor is welcoming and elegant, and there's a back area for seating along with the front & bar area.  The menu changes constantly with whatever they have in season and in stock (my boyfriend wanted the apple pie dessert but they didn't have it this night), so whatever I say here may not be present when you go there. However, considering our experience, you wouldn't go wrong selecting anything of their menu.  The offerings are mostly small plates, with a few entree selections, sides, and then dessert (which is on a separate menu/ask the server about the day's selections). There is a separate menu for wine (they have a huge wine selection) and cocktails (smaller, but still interesting). For drinks, my boyfriend chose the Mezcal is the New Black (which was a delight, bitter with a sweet aftertaste) and the Stanleyville (which is basically a Manhattan with cherry syrup added in). I chose the Caswell Cooler, which was a good gin-based drink that was refreshing.   For the small plates, we chose the foie gras funnel cake (!) and the beets plate. The beets plate had beets made 5 ways: pickled, "tartared", pureed, sorbet(ed) and panna cotta(ed). Everything on the plate was meant to be eaten. We both decided that the tatared beets (basically chopped up with a few things mixed in) was the best, although the sorbet and panna cotta were very good as well. The sorbet was slightly sweet, made with yellow beets, while the panna cotta was made with goat cheese and beats and then cubed on the plate. The foie gras funnel cake was a rich experience, with foie gras puree, funnel cake, peaches pureed and diced, and some pecans mixed in. The cake wasn't greasy nor oily, and the peaches and pecans gave the dish another layer of complexity that I enjoyed. Both plates were great for 2 people to share (the foie gras one might even serve 3 people, as it was rich.)  The risotto plate we shared, and for the price, it's quite small, although the shrimp on top were perfectly cooked and the risotto was flavorful. The risotto was creamy with an al-dente bite. However, this was the least favorite of the dishes. If I were to go back I'd probably try another small plate in its place.  For dessert we tried the deconstructed strawberry shortcake. This had to be our favorite dish of the night, as the strawberry jam/macerated strawberries were amazing with the perfectly sweet shortcake. The sorbet had a slight lemony taste to it, and reminded me of strawberry lemonade.   Definitely get reservations if you can -- as we ate people kept filing in for dinner! Also, with anything in the Elizabeth area, parking is a challenge and the lot behind the Stanley is small. We will be back when the seasons change -- I want to see how Paul changes the menu to fit the seasons. :)

2c0VpqO7KKEsUY-KYhLjkg.text: Tasty. Potentially the best restaurant in Charlotte. Our group of 6 ordered a bunch of appetizers and various main dishes. Everything was delicious and well prepared.  The goodness shows through the fact that you will likely need to make a reservation 1 to 2 weeks ahead!

JIJsBCmwY-4R30EuWO47Xw.text: The aromas- from perfect craft cocktails to sides to entrees to desserts to wine - set the stage for a memorable dinner.  We recommend the pork tenderloin & the shrimp risotto, although the menu changes regularly. We loved the lemon tart, the apple cobbler & the chocolate dessert with citrus paste.  Oh my goodness.  So lovely.

n2JkHm9WjvcGWwQtbuBGbQ.text: A friend and I went in on a Sunday after church around 1:30p and sat at the bar. The location was pretty easy to find and given the time of day parking wasn't the worst, although I know from visiting this area before that it can be. Don't be silly and not read the signage as to not get towed.   I want my home decorated like this place, so cute! I've seen the word "intimate" to describe the space, and I agree...one might just flat out say it's small and it's best to come at an off time like I did or to make reservations.   Sitting at the bar was a wonderful choice! The bartender, Damian, was the best. He knew the menu well and crafted delicious cocktails on tope of that he was funny.   I had the Beef Stir Fry and a boulevardier, both of which I enjoyed. My friend had the Shrimp and Grits and The Cortez which she enjoyed. I wasn't able to get what I actually wanted as they had sold out, and I expected that the donuts would be gone before we got there based on other reviews-and they were. That's to be expected when they are as good as reviewed.

0-OXk4wfq8yM5am4H_Kuuw.text: My husband and I finally ate at The Stanley after hearing a lot of hype about it. We made a reservation and ate there on a Wednesday evening.  Service: the service was phenomenal. Our server was also very knowledgeable about the menu and made great recommendations since it was our first time.  Drinks: this was probably our biggest disappointment here because we felt like the cocktails were sub-par. I got a gin cocktail and my husband got a bourbon and we ended up switching to wine and beer after.  Food: the food overall was delicious. We got 5 small plates (oysters, sticky bun, scallop, pork belly and tomato/mozzarella dish) and a dessert, all split between the two of us. I think we were just a little underwhelmed by the food given the price, especially compared to some of the other restaurants in Charlotte where you can have the same dining experience.

Lz7k9u9LXwVuaWB1Hmu5MQ.text: Update: went back a month later, Damien, my new bartender BFF, was working the bar and he remembered what type of drinks my friend and I liked.  If that isnt worth an updated review, then folks idk what is.  Dude is awesome.  Food is awesome.  Go there and relish in not being disappointed.  Also, enjoy having personal space and nice ambience, which is plentiful there.    Original: Really enjoyed hanging at the bar, eating a mean cheese plate and drinking well crafted drinks.  Damien makes incredible drinks, gives great service and is fun to chat with.  Highly recommend .

3O6WMODwvvrviO2T4HkXvw.text: We had a wonderful 5-star dinner experience at The Stanley.  We made reservations about 1.5 weeks in advance for a Friday evening dinner.  We were seated in the back dining area as soon as we arrived.  Our waiter welcomed us and quickly brought out the cocktails ordered.    The menu changes frequently - you can see what version they are on by looking at the top right corner of the menu.    We opted to start with the arugula salad and scallops small plate and then on to our main course with a risotto with shrimp and country ham and a NY strip.  The food was flawless - all so tasty, no complaints.  The atmosphere is intimate and beautiful.  People were dressed from very casual (shorts and polo shirts) to fancy.  The Stanley sets you up to have the perfect evening on your terms.

lyFU9eydgEkUOQKNbjKY0w.text: This place is great. It's very romantic and quaint. Beautiful decor, fun food and nice cocktail/wine/beer list.   The one downfall, the reason for not getting 5 stars and a glaring problem: the staff. So pretentious. Not welcoming and would not choose to go there for just a drink and to chill.   Dinner is lovely though. Me and my handsome date shared several small plates:   Steamed buns: so juicy and tender. I don't really care for pork belly and I ate every last bite. I would've ordered several more had not more food been coming!  Cornbread: perfectly sweet and moist!  Mustard greens and mushrooms: one of my favorite dishes. So much flavor in such a little bowl. Excellent.   Tempura quail: not worth it. No flavor. Weird. On the bone. Next.   Tostada: braised chicken, excellent flavor, didn't have a Mexican flavor profile which was a fun twist. Oh, and the tortillas are homemade. Yummm  Would really like to go back and try brunch! Maybe next trip!

SPLTR8S4IT3UxtHiwKuUuw.text: I have been here a few times now and can't say enough good things about it. They've done an excellent job remodeling the space - classy, warm, and a great mix of lighting colors.   The cocktail menu is creative and fun. Drinks are made thoughtfully and consistently. The wines are nicely selected and quite reasonably priced.   This farm to table restaurant changes their menu everyday. You'll notice consistencies with twists that change over time. There is creativity and thought not found in many places nearby. Also, you'll probably learn of new flavors and mediums that you've not had before.   My very first experience was full - drinks, apps, dinner with wine, dessert and ports. Our server was great at informing us about the menu, answering our questions, and pacing the meal. We left quite fulfilled and satisfied, even if an expensive meal.   Whether you want to enjoy an excellent cocktail by consistent and friendly bar tenders or want to sit down and have food, you'll leave with a smile.

HasjPVqvGznsssKCi9n1Jg.text: We came here a few weekends ago for brunch with another couple. The three star review is mostly due to an unpleasant interaction my husband had with a server. We were originally seated in the back room by a window. It was a beautiful day outside with the sun shining in, but the location was very hot, and at 8.5 months pregnant, I was pretty uncomfortable. My husband got up to ask our server if we could move to a location out of the sun, and she was not thrilled about this request, to say the least, and gave him some serious 'tude because we were ultimately moved to another server's section.   This said, our new server who was quite pleasant from the start (unlike the original woman), helpful, and attentive throughout our dining experience.   Our table ordered two donuts to share at the start of our meal (sooo good - highly recommend, and definitely go for the 'flavor of the day'!). I ordered the pancakes with a side of bacon for my main course. The pancakes were thin but had decent flavor. My husband ordered the fried chicken biscuit with scrambled eggs, gravy, and grits, which were cheesy and perfect.   I'd like to come back and try dinner here and will hopefully be able to upgrade my 3-star review to something higher.

SGksQiQm1VhydIIBqupdtg.text: I have been wanting to come here for awhile but has held off due to mixed reviews, but I am glad that I finally came!  We really enjoyed the intimate and quaint atmosphere! The decor was very homey and well decorated! The place seemed less like a restaurant and more like being a guest enjoying dinner at someone's house. The menu had the options of small plates or large plates. We ordered the deviled eggs and the poached egg with grits as our small plates and then shared the pork chop with squash puree. Each plate was very unique and flavorful and we enjoyed trying the different foods! We ended with bread pudding for dessert, which happens to be my favorite desert! Yum! I saw other reviews of this place say that the food was not very flavorful. I am not sure if it was just because they went when the restaurant was still very new or if it just takes a lot of spices and seasonings in order for them to taste their food or what, but I thought the food was very good and flavorful!  The service was also very professional and friendly!  I highly recommend this place for a romantic dinner out and for those who want to have fun trying different and unique combinations of foods. I will definitely be back here!

6fVmKC450HFYmg7nhNTTnQ.text: I love this little gem in Charlotte. It was recently nominated for a James Beard award for Best New Restaurant, and I understand why. The high quality small plates, which are matched by delicious cocktails by the new(er) mixologist. The chefs all know how to knock out some good dishes. I would love to make a recommendation that you "must have", but these guys use fresh and local ingredients and therefore the menu changes often!

wfSRryYAXywSHPpsunzF-w.text: My wife and I recently had an incredible dinner at The Stanley. The space is intimate (see: miniscule), so make sure you have reservations. The restaurant is nicely decorated and the bar looks immaculate.   Our service was great and very informative which was welcome as we needed help getting a grip on many of the dishes. With his direction we decided to share several small dishes and share one entree. Great decision.   We started with the surf & turf, squash blossoms, and beet small plates. Awesome flavors and beautiful presentation. We were still pretty hungry so we decided on two more small plates: pork belly and bone marrow. The marrow was DAAAAANK.   We split the fried chicken entree which was cooked perfectly and the mole sauce with a succotash type mix was delightful...you can tell they make the mole in house. Super fresh. For dessert we had the bread pudding which was essentially a French toast stick w caramel ice cream.   All of the flavors were delightful. If you like a fine dining experience that focuses on unique dishes and presentation, you will enjoy The Stanley and understand the pricing. Quite frankly, you get what you pay for. Ignore the reviews complaining about price... this place is worth it and probably just not a fit for them

VhcpPofL2Ul1yANrfYV7rw.text: The Stanley is a hive of trendsetting activity from the time you walk in the door until you leave.   It was able to accommodate our group even w/slight modifications to the number of women who would be joining.   The service was fantastic from start to finish.  He guided us w/recommendations.   Starting w/the Scallop, the scallop was tasty & perfectly cooked.  The sauce was delicious.  This is def a small plate & not really enough to split w/another person.   The Surf & Turf slaw was fantastic.  W/no hint of acid to the dish, the turf part generally tastes like eating a raw hamburger patty.  Composing the bite together was ok but def needed something acidic possibly in the citrus family to really boost it over the edge to phenomenal.   The tomatoes many ways - sometimes its good to stick to 1 or 2 ways.  The foam was kinda of lost w/no real taste.  A+ for the technicality of the dish!  Whatever was underneath the ice cream for the cobbler, I was scared that I had broken one of my crowns.  I should have let the ice cream soften the garnish a bit more.  After that 1st bite, placed the ice cream on the cobbler - neither were overly sweet & the berries which I wish there allowing the berries to shine thru.

GG78Z8Vbqq2JJqT_yEQ3Yg.text: I was really excited to try to the Stanley, went there on our rare night without kids. We sat at the full service bar which was nice to have that option since reservations were hard to get. However the service was very lacking. Not welcoming at all and I felt like I was interrupting by trying to order. When we did get the drinks, they definitely looked pretty but tasted very watered down. When we got to the food orders, another bartender came to help. He was better and I was somewhat relieved. The food was seasonal and I liked that they changed the menu very frequently.   We ordered the chorizo tostada which was awesome, had fresh green onions and jalapenos. Next we had the fried chicken, unfortunately the seasoning was lacking. We were more excited about the veggies because they had more flavor. We ended up ordering the shrimp risotto with beets after seeing it on a customer's plate.  One more dish which was lacking flavor but everything was at least cooked well.   We didn't really get any explanations on any of the dishes which we assumed was because we were sitting at the bar. However as more customers came in and started ordering at the bar, they were getting much more attention with detailed explanations about the ingredients. So the service continued to be disappointing. We had to ask for the dessert menu, very tough to spend my money at this restaurant!    Had to ask for recommendations on the dessert, they seemed a bit snooty when we asked what a creameux was. Ended up getting the described chocolate cake which seemed more like a ganache mousse. All in all, the service was dismal and we felt even worse because it was apparent that we were being singled out. All I know is, we were well dressed but didn't look like your typical WASP customer sitting there. Unfortunately the food wasn't good enough to overcome this. I'm being generous with the 3 stars rating.

Mr1Z2sCm1y7oi0cD3kGjvg.text: Amazing cocktail and wine list.  Perfect location to meet friends for nice dinner or even drinks at the bar. I really loved the tempura vegetables and German Riesling they offer.  I'm looking forward to trying the winter menu and brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stanley - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tempura vegetables

NtzsrAUMdOqbYGybHVltXw.text: I wasn't overly impressed with my visit to The Stanley after much hype about the new restaurant in town. We ordered several small plates to share and the pork buns were certainly worth noting. We had planned to order the "secret menu" burger, but were told it is only served at the bar...a full five feet away from our table. We were disappointed. The specialty drinks were fun, but a bit pricey so we each had one and called it a night on that. The desserts were creative, but tasty. Not sure I'll return or really recommend it over some other restaurants in the area.

wcwws-CBWook8BAMADGljg.text: I wasnt as impressed with this place as I expected.  The restaurant is beautiful but the service from the beginning was truly sub par.  They just didn't seem friendly or really very welcoming.  The food was very expensive and sounded creative but nothing was overly impressive.   The drinks were pretty good but again, overpriced.    Risotto-- tasty,  standard, small portion even though main entree  Sticky bun-- basically like chic fil a's chicken minis. Nothing unique  Squash poppers-- such a small portion and bland Tempura green beans- bland Pork belly, crowd favorite. Very tasty.  Tomatoe chips and cheese- bland  Desserts- pretty good! Cobbler was good. The chocolate and peanut butter dessert was very good and a bit rich. Easy to share.   Overall, just not worth the time or money. I wouldn't be back.

dORMoZBAfeoQ6XllFxm4EQ.text: In the immortal words of Shelby..."Remember what Daddy always says - an ounce of pretension is worth a pound of manure!"  Be proud, but for heaven's sake..actually Be good.  P.S. You can't get a drink while you wait because you aren't "allowed" to be served until you are seated and you aren't "allowed" to just order from the bar.

HCdiqMcJemPq10pwbOLUFQ.text: Called and was told there were no tables available until late so we planned to make reservations for another time...  Got a call back a few minutes later and they said that something came open and we could seat in 15 minutes.   Excellent customer service from phone to table are the makings of a great evening. Ask for Chris as a server, particularly to get an accurate pairing of wine or knowledgeable description of the cocktails.   Menu changes daily, but taste like old favorites.  Our Meal:  Salad course was perfect...arugula, apples, and Asher Blue; balsamic strawberries, goat cheese, and mixed greens  Second course star was the scallops...tartare, chips, and bitter micro greens; scallops, fennel, and lardons  Main course favorite was the risotto...bone in pork chop, braised collards, and sweet potato mash; shrimp risotto with early summer vegetables  Dessert...deconstructed strawberry shortcake, and chocolate pot de creme with peanut butter powder   House Red - Italics Red Blend worked nicely with everything.

Yf8eONXEkvcmeBFjiZh9wA.text: TLDR: The food is fresh, creative, and delicious. The servers are friendly and accommodating. The vibe is luxurious with a bit of pretentiousness. If your looking for a restaurant to celebrate a special occasion--such as a wedding anniversary--consider The Stanley.

5mHey9E_Fnl9Ct9RiUludw.text: In terms of small plate restaurants in Charlotte, in my opinion, the Stanley isn't the best one.  However, service was excellent as were a few of the dishes we got to try. The Stanely is located right on 7th St in the building that used to belong to Crisp. Two doors down is the Crunkleton, btw. There's no designated lot, they are located next to a small shopping center parking but I would not rely on that on a weekend night. We ubered and had no issues.  I made reservations for a Friday evening at 7:30 but, turns out, I didn't have to because it was not busy at all. We were brought to their back section of the restaurant. They have a few tables in front for outdoor dining, a bar area, front section, and area in the back.  Our waiter dutifully explained the concept of the restaurant and menu and took our drink orders. I was in the mood for a margarita but that wasn't a choice on their drink menu so the waiter offered me the 'bartender's choice' where I could describe my ideal flavor profile and then bartender would whip up something based off that. I received a drink that was citrusy and made with tequila. It was delicious!   Our order of small plates soon followed: Mixed green salad Fried chicken steam buns Tempura Scallops   My favorite was the fried chicken steam buns - they came with a savory blackberry jam. I really enjoyed these. I also really liked the scallops, they were served with mini melon balls that provided a nice, fresh bite.   I would make this place more of a stop for a drink and one small plate and then go. I wouldn't make this a food destination.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stanley - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken buns with blackberry jam
Photo of The Stanley - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tempura
Photo of The Stanley - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mixed greens salad

dlb0NFrX3VnixHLxTHmkOQ.text: Had a fantastic dinner with family the other night at this wonderful restaurant.  First time visit and we weren't sure what to expect.  We knew there was a small plate aspect going in and I, frankly, thought I would walk away a little hungry but I could not have been more wrong.  The food was fantastic and the service was impeccable.  I left fully satiated.    We started out with a few craft cocktails that a description of delicious would fall too short.  The Basil Station was craft delight that woke up the taste buds.  Next we ordered some small plates.  The Panzenella was awesome with a variety of flavor popping locally sourced tomatoes.  The Squash Blossum Tempura with eggplant, tomato and basil was delightful.  I had the Buttermilk Fried Chicken with Potato Salad and Waxed Green Beans.  It was delicious and tender.  The Blackberry BBQ sauce was an excellent highlight.  Midway through the meal, I had another craft cocktail, The Rising Sun, and the mixture of smokey Mezcal made me want more, more, more.  For the "piece de resistance" I had the Chocolate Mousse Cake with a Carmel Ice Cream scoop, and almond nut brittle topping.  Bravo Chef!  This was an excellent experience and I left with a full and unwanting belly.  Thanks for the above board service by Savanah and MaryJane!  They were great!  We will be back!

8BKb-rgAftujrbU7-Ort7A.text: So this should definitely be a special occasion place because it is pricey. We were a party of 5 and had two rounds of drinks, apps and dinner and it ran us over $500.  What was good were some of the appetizers and drinks but the mains were only ok. In general, I felt like this place was trying very hard to be interesting and unique and NOT tasty. I think the hype has passed them now.

HM609mAM-HSsSiLbVJAQNA.text: Had dinner at the Stanley on July 13 to celebrate my birthday (the following day). Holy cow, everything was incredibly was delicious. The only 'bad' thing about the Q.C.'s rise in culinary arts is there are SO many wonderful places, it's hard to hit a great place twice. But we WILL be back to The Stanley. I cannot rave enough about how every dish, cocktail and presentation were absolutely beyond expectation. Highly recommend!! Happy Birthday to me, indeed! #fetenationalefrancaise #quatorzejuillet

J-Fyi_Vml3akOesnMCgIBw.text: Came for brunch with a couple of friends and it did not disappoint.   The donuts are dense and can easily share and I highly recommend them!  We had the chocolate and the donut of the day -- mixed berry. Yum!  I had the omelette and the menu said it came with potato home fries but my plate had grits instead. I thought about asking about it, but decided not to since the grits were yummy too.   The decor is very lovely and we sat in the back, past the kitchen and the restrooms so it was little quieter back there. Our server was very kind and we thoroughly enjoyed our time. The patio was cute with string lights too! Will definitely be back for dinner.

vei80tOelFg8AIJUW770Zw.text: I am not sure we could have picked a better place to have mothers day. The Food was wonderful, the service wonderful and provided by Chris, not hovering but always seemed to be there for water fill ups, needs wants or just to check in, and never once after we had put food in our mouths.  Some bearded dude seemed irked i was taking pictures for YELP, but he will get over it. I definitely recommend this place, the food, the service, they had the entire package. w-6nzH8FUux9dn4ghYehhQ.text: Terrible brunch. Don't waste your time here. The group started with the fried cheese and the donuts. Fried cheese was ok, nothing amazing. The donuts took awhile to get out due to an issue which they told us about and we were ok with. When they came out they were completely lacking flavor and dense. They were basically a vessel to deliver icing. The absolute worst was the chicken sandwich. Do not order this. It was a single chicken tender on a massive piece of bread. 1/3 of the sandwich had chicken on it. See the pictures below. Such a disappointment. Also we had a vegetarian in the group and they wouldn't do a BLT without the bacon and add an  egg with cheese.

vwx4wkYbFyTcTIhc2gZWcQ.text: What an experience! The recently James Beard nominated restaurant is top in class for using local and in-season ingredients across an incredible menu. Four of us split 5 small plates, 2 larger plates (duck and shrimp), an order of cornbread and 2 desserts. The textures and colors on the plates stood out as adding so much to the experience of tasting this delicious food. We let our server guide us through the menu with recommendations and she did an amazing job of keeping us on a great track - trust the experts!   The Foie Gras salad was one of the most unique dishes I've ever had (the strawberry puree was mind-blowing). We also had the surf and turf tower (great portion and delicious), tostada (interesting play on what you'd think of here), and pork belly steam buns (delicious and 2 per order so I'd order however many you need for one per person!)  The duck entree is delicious and the shrimp one sounds simplistic but the beet risotto is unlike anything I'd had before. Overall, this makes for an amazing dinner experience and probably rivals any restaurant across Charlotte!

Photo of The Stanley - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon tart

1Fq00Gi_JLDToWqHBeDbOg.text: Toggling between 2-3 stars on this one and am beginning to think that all of the farm to table restaurants in Charlotte are way overhyped. From Heirloom to Haymaker to The Stanley, I've felt all have been subpar at best, with a hefty designer price tag attached. I'm a huge supporter of local owners and when you marry that with my obvious foodie tendencies, farm to table restaurants are kind of a no brainer so.. WHAT IS UP?!  My bf made a reservation at The Stanley a few weeks in advance for a celebratory new job dinner. I was looking forward to Stanley for weeks, and we were both excited to give them a try.   We ordered:  -Surf & Turf: Probably the most unique item on the menu. Their rendition of a surf and turf included beef tartare and fried oysters, which is a unique twist. I'm a huge fan of beef tartare so I liked this dish overall, but the flavors didn't exactly complement.   -Pork Belly Steamed Buns: These were yummy, but honestly you could get this elsewhere for half the price  -Chicken Pot Pie: A decent chicken pot pie overall, but not at all memorable. Portion is also incredibly small  -Foie Gras - Absolutely gorgeous and almost resembled a dessert? Unfortunately, flavors were all wrong and did not complement. Imagine eating a dessert.. with foie gras. We couldn't bare to even finish this dish halfway  -Broccoli and Cauliflower Gratin: Our waiter could not stop raving about this dish and I honestly cannot even remember what it tasted like?  -White Chocolate Bread Pudding, Marshmallow, Sweet Potatoe: DESSERT aka the saving grace! Probably my favorite of the entire experience. Beautifully plated, unique flavors and delicious!   Most dishes resembled art pieces, which I adore, but the foodie in me pleads for substance over beauty.. always. Not a terrible experience, but again, with a $100+ price tag, I'd hope it would at least be memorable. I did enjoy the ambiance and would come back for drinks and dessert. It's possible we ordered all the wrong things or the kitchen had a rough night, but can't say I have any desire to taste the rest of the menu.

drtHkzIXEv4W-ZhB7xVyXw.text: I have been wanting to try this place since it opened, and their reservations list shows just how popular it is, so make sure you get one (a week in advance!).  The restaurant itself is quaint well done. We arrived early for our reservation and they have a nice little lounge area with a couch and a couple chairs for you to sit and wait.  We even got waited on there for a pre dinner cocktail!   Cocktails were good - I tried the Stanleyville (their version of an old fashioned), and the Prince of Thieves.  Hard to pick a favorite here.   Their menu is a changing one because they are a farm to table restaurant and I personally love this. We got the steam buns with pork belly (so, so good, you have to try these!!), cornbread, Brussels sprouts, and the raviolo (this was a bit small to share, but so tasty. The broth alone was delicious).   For the dessert, we went with the carrot cake and the butternut squash creme brulee (it's healthy if they have veggies right!?).  The creme brulee was my fav and not overly sweet!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stanley - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stanleyville cocktail, cornbread and steam buns in the back.
Photo of The Stanley - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carrot cake on the left, butternut squash creme brûlée on the right

4SMouV0LHjkXiuiNxz3Ldw.text: We had a couple of good recommendations to try the Stanley, so we used our anniversary as a good excuse to check out out.   Reservations are recommended, although if you eat early like we do, you can probably get away without one.   We started with The Cortez cocktail which we both loved. It was refreshing and not too sweet.   We always go with small plates at a restaurant like this. They change the menu almost daily, so you never know what will be on it.   We tried the Surf & Turf, Foie Gras, Steam Buns (pork belly), Braised Chicken Tostada, and Short Rib Ravioli. We loved everything with one exception -- the ravioli. It wasn't bad, but it definitely didn't compare to how good everything else was. It was supposed to have goat cheese in it, but we tasted no cheese at all. The chicken tostada was our favorite followed closely by the surf and turf.   For dessert we got the Swiss Roll. I think the menu was misleading on this one. I don't like chocolate, but the menu said white chocolate, cranberry, and pistachio. I assumed it didn't have chocolate because it said white chocolate, but that was not the case (it just had a white chocolate drizzle). My husband loved it though.   It's a farm to table restaurant and you can definitely tell the ingredients are fresh. I wasn't super impressed with the service. It was good enough, but our waiter felt a little cold.   There's a lot of complaints in the reviews that I think are not the fault of the restaurant. Yes, it's fairly pricey. This should be expected at a farm to table small plates restaurant. We felt like the quality of the food lived up to the price.   I think The Stanley is definitely worth checking out. Just make sure to have the right expectations coming in.

Order the rib eye rare medium rare but deliver medium well.  I didn't send back cause it's still decent, why throw away food.  In return I got a glass of free  .  The plate was assembled really pretty!

wyLL-P-tiWmE6Ik1jOh_Hg.text: This is one of the few reviews I'm super excited to write! Chef Paul Verica has hit a home run in his new restaurant down in Elizabeth. If I was independently wealthy and food had no calories, I would eat here every day.   The restaurant is small, so either go early and sit at the bar or make reservations far in advance. GM Stephen is always there to greet you with a warm smile. The decor is balanced and not over the top. I went one day and sat next two two other very prominent chefs in the city... this is the level of attention this place is getting.   The menu changes frequently due to the fact they use seasonal ingredients. Some of my personal favorites that have been on the menu have been the steak tartare with fried oysters and the smoked trout with beets. I'm also a big fan of their fried chicken steamed bun - an asian inspired dish with all the southern attitude you can handle. My strategy is to order a few small plates as opposed to one large entree, but if you want to go that route, the pork chop was my favorite - sous vide to perfection and then seared, it's not to be missed.   The cocktails are also very inventive and change with the seasons. I would just recommend going at least four times a year to hit every one.   For a special occasion (or any occasion someone wants to take me), this is my favorite place in the Charlotte area for a great meal.   Pro-tip: They do brunch (and home made -very inventive- donuts).

-L3jy1QxBn9hs330Zc-7YQ.text: I have been wanting to go to The Stanley for awhile and it was worth the wait. The place looks small from the outside but there is a back room that holds more people.   The atmosphere and decorations were spot on if you are going for a living room vibe . It was relaxing and decorated very well.   The service was very professional , quick and knowledgeable. The restaurant has tapas options so the small plates were great to share with another person or group of people.   We got the devil eggs and a dish with kale, bacon, poached egg and couscous. We ordered the pork chop to split for our meal and it was really juicy, tender and cooked to perfection . I am not a big pork person outside of bacon but I would  definitely go back The Stanley just for the pork chops.    Lastly we had the bread pudding dessert and it was really good! Highly recommend it.

z-tq6D7nQXrdIOzfGmFpyg.text: I wanted to like the Stanley so much. I was really excited by the concept and the decor looked unreal! Based on reviews I had read/heard, I really expected to be impressed. Charlotte Agenda blew the restaurant out of the water saying it was amazing.  Overall, it left a lot to be desired  Let's start with the positives: The restaurant is incredibly beautiful and True to the photos. It's a quaint little spot with gorgeous accents.   We went with a group of girls all looking for bites and cocktails. None of the cocktails really grabbed our attention so we moved to wine.  The appetizers were ok. The waitress highly praised a special app called "The 11 Ways of Corn". It was not good. One of the ways was a liquid corn feature that tasted like the water from a can of creamed corn. The service was ok. I received the shrimp and grits which were cold and mushy. The flavor was a little bland. Overall, the experience was ok.   A manager never came over and asked how our food was. To be honest, the bill was not aligned with the service and the food we received. To pay $12 for a squash blossom seemed outrageous as a small plate in Charlotte, NC.  The atmosphere is nice, but its not worth the money for an "ok" experience with all the restaurants Charlotte has to offer.
