_ppuIeQw-Bbhi69k8aa_6Q.text: Some of the best food and service I've ever had. Terrific staff and imaginative menu items. Surprisingly generous portions for the main courses and every item was so fresh. The only critique was they used standard ice with their old fashioned - I'm a purist so I appreciate the single large ice cube.

T6KC7sN9IMOW3lt6nORBYw.text: This "hidden" gem in the heart of Elizabeth is my new best place for Sunday Brunch! You gotta try the Donut of the Day(on the appetizer menu); its to die for! I had the BLT which was full of fresh local tomatoes & lettuce & the bacon was thick, meaty, & flavorful. My husband got the Shrimp & Grits & midway through our meal, we switched plates---this dish was amazing. The Shrimp was fresh, it had fresh okra & corn throughout, & the roux was the best we've ever had. Last, but not least, get the Bloody Mary--m-m-GUD!

acHbKu7L0jHkQDtRchPuIA.text: I got to eat an early dinner at The Stanley on Saturday, 4 August.  WHAT a treat!  The only (and I mean ONLY) negative thing I can say for the entire experience is that the hostess was none too friendly... but once seated, our server, Neal, and a host of other servers and staff made our visit beyond delightful!!  We started with the cocktail menu.  I'm a bourbon girl myself, so once Neal told me that the owners were all bourbon lovers who made their own version of the Old Fashioned, I chose it at once!  They call it the Stanleyville, and it was perfection.  I also tried the melon cocktail (rum based) whose name I can't recall... it was very fruity and refreshing, but no substitute for a good bourbon!  My girlfriend and I started with an order of the Scallops, Arugula Salad, and Fried Cheese... If they had turned any of these small plates into larger plates, I think I still would've found the will to lick the bowls!  Not a speck was wasted.  The flavors were clean, fresh, and main ingredient forward.  I never knew how lovely a lima bean succotash could be with scallops, or how yummy figs could be with peppery fresh arugula, or how the simple act of frying cheese could leave us tracing the dish for any smudge of leftover sauce and cheese... a truly amazing experience.  BUT WAIT - then we ordered a dinner to share... They had a beautiful white fish just in from Beaufort that day... I WISH I could remember the name of it, but it was very grouper-like in texture and taste.  Served with greens and wild mushrooms in a brown sauce... we were, once again, drinking the dregs from the bowl...  AND THEN THERE WAS DESSERT... which we TOTALLY weren't going to eat, I swear... and then everyone started saying words which compelled me to say, "We'll share the bread pudding!"... They used some wiley Jedi-mind-trickery, folks!  And here's where my review ends... if you want to know how freaking amazing their bread pudding is... go eat at The Stanley!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stanley - Charlotte, NC, United States

CJXI7QNleW4Og4ebpw2rSg.text: Charlotte drinkers need to stand up to cocktail pricing!  Ordered a beer, Bloody Mary and a donut.  Beer was fine, but the Bloody Mary came out in a high ball glass and was weak all around.  Left me 26 dollars poorer.  Nice place, great donut but every time a place charges so much for so little I am left wondering why I leave my house.  Am I the only one?

6scqxfM0AYIfap8olDUjxQ.text: AH! There is nothing worse than wanting to love a restaurant, but come away disappointed.  Cocktails were good, food was a mixed bag (although the Surf & Turf appetizer was one of the best dishes I've had in the last couple of years), and our service was just poor.  Cocktails: It's obvious that this establishment takes great pride in their mixology. The cocktail list was interesting and fresh, and our drinks were delicious!  Food: Like I said, the appetizer was fantastic. Root veg slaw, beef tartare, and fried oysters were apparently meant to be. Who'd have thought? However, our main courses (trout and duck) were a bit underwhelming. There was nothing BAD, but it didn't feel special, either. Just no WOW moment.  Service: This was a WOW moment for all the wrong reasons. When setting up the reservation on RESY earlier in the week, the restaurant instructed me to list any food allergies or sensitivities along with my reservation, so that the chef would be aware ahead of time. I listed my inability to consume dairy (it's a temporary and VERY annoying food restriction) just as instructed. Our reservation was at 5:30 in the middle of the week (we have a tiny baby at home), so when my husband and I arrived, we were one of only three tables seated in the whole place. Our server introduced herself and then began reviewing what on the menu was dairy-free. Now, that doesn't sound so bad, however, it was. She was barking at us. Like, rudely. As if I was ruining her day with my inability to consume cream. I don't know if she was having a bad day, but there was no smile, there was no small talk, there was no  "have you been here before?" or "here are my favorites". And it never got better. She never checked to see if our meals were to our liking and we had to flag her down for a second round of cocktails. I was killing her with kindness and the only time she even cracked a partial-smile was when she was returning our bill after running the card...too little too late.  I might have given 4 stars if this review was on food and drinks alone, but I would have given 1 star if this review was only on service. With a bill that was around $175 for 2 folks I feel like it's okay to expect friendly wait staff. I've had friends who have dined at the Stanley and had wonderful service, so I have to guess my experience was just a one-off (I HOPE). I will try them again and cross my fingers I get someone who actually likes their job.

b_FBmZjJBl11GOmzxk1tUg.text: Went last night with three friends.  Service was friendly and efficient.  The trout was excellent, and I enjoyed a sample of my friend's shrimp and grits.  Sort of sorry that you really can't lick the plates.  Sauces were that good. The bread pudding with pecan sauce was to-die-for.  Wow!  PS:  you can actually carry on a conversation in this restaurant...a real plus!

uTfbhtLF-7cGEkScIZM8qA.text: The Stanley has been well reviewed hereunder. My experience is that it is a solid addition to the Charlotte fine dining scene. The front room seats 24, or so. It is, as mentioned, cosy. It is not crowded, though. There is sufficient room between tables. Servers do not struggle to place food. The decor is warm and familiar. The lighting is sufficient for conversation and menu reading, which is bit of a surprise since so many other prefer flashlight levels of lighting. Silverware is quality and heavy, German made chinaware. Ingenious and attractive seasonal table floral vases. The wine list is an education with items uncommon in Charlotte such as French cremant. There were eight places empty when we entered, plus several at the bar, and just two when we left plus several more added to the bar. Even with this, conversation at the table was of no trouble.  Our server was attentive and receptive to delays when necessary for ordering. Two small plates and two main courses ordered. The arugula, country ham, blue cheese, balsamic was well mixed and the ham a nice and unexpected addition. The blue cheese made no appearance. Duck breast was flavorful. It could have been more trimmed yet the duck fat is what gives the flavor. It comes sliced so trimming is easy on the plate after the first bite. Bed of farro, turnip, carrot and parsnip all in clear participation. The pork tenderloin may have been the high point. Lovely presentation. The price for the table is no more than what a similar table elsewhere in the city main dining establishments would carry. I will return.  This visit was on a Wednesday night. Parking can be tricky. Reservation was made and restaurant sent SMS follow to confirm.

Bg4r3pi3jub2Yh3HSE7SZg.text: Told a man and his husband that they could not sit together because they're "not that kind of a restaurant." So if you want segregated, medieval dining, this is the place for you! Hard pass for me, personally, I'd rather eat my own vomit.

bBUis1jBy3HFDC8PmI_Mfg.text: Group out of 6 visited for brunch. Service was very good.  Nice ambiance.  Chicken and biscuit was good although a chicken nugget was substituted for other cut which was somewhat of a surprise and disappointment. The other ordered dishes were good; the BLT as well as the pimento cheese sandwich with collards were both very good.  The donuts were also very good.  Great bloody mary.  Will try again for dinner.

SrcTQ6X5C5k8h4-Q7MNPIA.text: Fantastic food, great ambience and just overall a great dining experience ! All of the food was delicious, I think we ordered just about everything on the menu. It's a great option for a finer dining experience.

yRqc01OrcMPFlCmf7O4CNA.text: This is an exceptional new restaurant offering a farm to table menu that changes daily.  We had most of the small plates and every one was better than the last. Cocktails were excellent too.

61hSF3JiQ4G5LX0kfPi0Xg.text: Good restaurant but not as good as I expected We wanted to order just 2 dishes to start.  Waiter said order more and he would space them out. We ordered 5 and all 5 came at the same time. Surf and turf was amazing. Tempura beans and steamed bun were just ok. Pork belly was interesting. For main dishes the pork chop was good Meat loaf was average.  Desserts were good. We had a gift card from the last place chef owned. Very disappointed that he did not honor it. We asked when we made the reservation and they said they would honor it. Manager said they stopped honoring it July 1. Don't get it since money went to the owner. Oh well.  Will be back but not any time soon. Much better restaurants in Charlotte. For the money.

JO4LxGcuRAUnC6AC4aY-Ew.text: This is a beautiful restaurant -The colors, the bar, the lighting - are all gorgeous.  From the minute we walked in, everyone working there was so nice and so helpful.  We started with cocktails - a Stanleyville, The Nobleman and Mezcal is the New Black. All were interesting and delicious! Don't be put off by the color of the Mezcal, the Smokey flavor was really enjoyable. We shared several dishes including: the Tempura which was light and crisp, the Foie gras funnel cake had amazing fresh peach slivers, peach dust and dehydrated peaches, the porky belly steamed buns were my favorite of the small plates I tried, and the risotto and shrimp was creamy and delicious. Unable to pass on dessert, we tried the unbelievable strawberry shortcake.This too had strawberry dust, fresh and dehydrated strawberries with a very flavorful sorbet and was absolutely delicious! We also had the apple pie with a sweet rich caramel ice cream with crunchies. Loved this dessert too! Every dish was as beautiful as it was delicious. Even the music selection added to the fabulous ambiance in The Stanley. I highly recommend it and can't wait to return.
